summary:
Collect metrics about the insert size distribution of a paired-end library. This tool provides useful metrics for validating library construction including the insert size distribution and read orientation of paired-end libraries.

The expected proportions of these metrics vary depending on the type of library preparation used, resulting from technical differences between pair-end libraries and mate-pair libraries. For a brief primer on paired-end sequencing and mate-pair reads, see the GATK Dictionary.

The CollectInsertSizeMetrics tool outputs the percentages of read pairs in each of the three orientations (FR, RF, and TANDEM) as a histogram. In addition, the insert size distribution is output as both a histogram (.insert_size_Histogram.pdf) and as a data table (.insert_size_metrics.txt).

Note: Metrics labeled as percentages are actually expressed as fractions!

Usage example:

java -jar picard.jar CollectInsertSizeMetrics \
      I=input.bam \
      O=insert_size_metrics.txt \
      H=insert_size_histogram.pdf \
      M=0.5
Note: If processing a small file, set the minimum percentage option (M) to 0.5, otherwise an error may occur.

Please see InsertSizeMetrics for detailed explanations of each metric.

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: If true (default), then the sort order in the header file will be ignored.
arguments.name: --ASSUME_SORTED

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Generate mean, sd and plots by trimming the data down to MEDIAN + DEVIATIONS*MEDIAN_ABSOLUTE_DEVIATION. This is done because insert size data typically includes enough anomalous values from chimeras and other artifacts to make the mean and sd grossly misleading regarding the real distribution.
arguments.name: --DEVIATIONS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: File to write insert size Histogram chart to.
arguments.name: --Histogram_FILE

arguments.summary: Explicitly sets the Histogram width, overriding automatic truncation of Histogram tail. Also, when calculating mean and standard deviation, only bins <= Histogram_WIDTH will be included.
arguments.name: --HISTOGRAM_WIDTH

arguments.summary: If true, also include reads marked as duplicates in the insert size histogram.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_DUPLICATES

arguments.summary: Input SAM/BAM/CRAM file.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The level(s) at which to accumulate metrics.
arguments.name: --METRIC_ACCUMULATION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Minimum width of histogram plots. In the case when the histogram would otherwise betruncated to a shorter range of sizes, the MIN_HISTOGRAM_WIDTH will enforce a minimum range.
arguments.name: --MIN_HISTOGRAM_WIDTH

arguments.summary: When generating the Histogram, discard any data categories (out of FR, TANDEM, RF) that have fewer than this percentage of overall reads. (Range: 0 to 1).
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_PCT

arguments.summary: The file to write the output to.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: Stop after processing N reads, mainly for debugging.
arguments.name: --STOP_AFTER

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version
